metadata.title: CVE-2019-18610 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in manager.c in Sangoma Asterisk through 13.x, 16.x, 17.x and Certified Asterisk 13.21 through 13.21-cert4. A remote authenticated Asterisk Manager Interface (AMI) user without system authorization could use a specially crafted Originate AMI request to execute arbitrary system commands.

criterions.comment: asterisk package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:16.10.0~dfsg-1').
